intro: Prunus spinosa proles depressa, commonly known as the dwarf blackthorn, is a compact shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, dark blue berries that ripen in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters and has dense, dark green foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. The berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
